400 acs. Pr. Geo. Co. on the lower side
of Georges Br. of Nammisseen Cr; adj.
Kirk, Ravenscroft, Rowland, Tatum &
Griffin; 1 Jun 1750 in the 23rd Year of
the Reign of George II, Thomas Lee
President of our Council and
Commander in Chief of our said Colony
and Dominion at Williamsburgh, p.1. £2.
[Regranted to Joseph Gibson in
Dinwiddie Co. PB 34, p.793]

HENRY HATCHER, 400 acs. Goochland Co.; on both sides of steep Br. of
Swift Cr.; adj. Henry Hatcher, James
Smith & the Henrico County Line
[S51°W]; 1 Jun 1750, p.2. £2. Whereas
by Pat. 20 July 1738 gtd. Daniel Stoner
and John James Flournoy since dec’d
[PB 18, p.63]. Whereas the sd Daniel
Stoner in whom the Right of the sd Land
became vested after the Death of the sd
John James Flournoy by Survivourship
hath failed to pay Quitrents and make
Cultivation and improvement and Henry
Hatcher hath made Suit and obtained a
G. for the Same.
